Class Maze

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Maze(java.io.Reader reader)
      Creates a maze from a reader and makes it into a character matrix - mazeData, if and only if the file contains a start and end position.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Maze

        public Maze(java.io.Reader reader)
        Creates a maze from a reader and makes it into a character matrix - mazeData, if and only if the file contains a start and end position. When it finds the startPosition it will set that position to the attribute startPosition. To access the coordinates in the maze, it has to be done through mazeData[y][x] - since the maze is represented as a character matrix, which index it's values as row, column.
        Parameters:
        reader - - a file reader with a maze .txt-file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - - If the maze file did not have a start and end character.

    • Method Detail

      • isMovable

        public boolean isMovable(Position p)
        Checks if a given position is a movable position (i.e " " in the maze). The position has to be greater than -1 on x and y and be in the interval of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        p - - the position to check
        Returns:
        true if the position is anything but an asterisk and inside the interval of the matrix.

      • isGoal

        public boolean isGoal(Position p)
        Checks if the given position is a goal position (i.e "G" in the maze).
        Parameters:
        p - - the position to check
        Returns:
        true if the position is 'G'.

      • getStartPosition

        public Position getStartPosition()
        Gets the start position of the maze.
        Returns:
        the attribute startPosition.
